author: _shemnon
content:
Here's updated tstore tests - https://github.com/shemnon/ethereum-tests/pull/4

I'd push it to ethereum/tests but I know how dmitry is about tests created from uncommitted artifacts

One notable tweak- tests 16 and 17 need a constant adjusted or a tstore field adjusted.  Newer versions of YUL generate PUSH0, so the extraOpcodesGas either needs to go down by one or we need to tstore into not-zero.

Everything elses is vanilla, except for the info blocks.
In the PR I also changed the network to Cancun, and you will see other gas deltas because of PUSH0.

At least the fillers can be used directly.

author: _shemnon
content: Its the info blocks that won't have "correct" hashes for the besu binary and retesteth binary, as they are built off of uncommitted branches.  But those are not used in tests and are for auditability.

author: _shemnon
content: I see you refilled with solidity 0.8.17, which doesn't generate `PUSH0`.  How will `PUSH0` figure into future re-fillings where source is provided and complied?  Will the `solc` target be set to London/Paris/Merge?  Or perhaps the lowest labeled fork in the post section?

author: marioevz
content: Release v1.0.0 of Execution Spec Tests: Pytest + Cancun Devnet 7 Fixtures: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/v1.0.0
